revised_title: Stanley Wells Kemp: A Pioneering Biologist and Oceanographer
tldr: Stanley Wells Kemp was a distinguished biologist and oceanographer who made significant contributions to the fields of entomology, zoology, and marine biology. He conducted extensive research on deep-sea organisms, crustaceans, and insects, and played a crucial role in the development of oceanographic research through his work with the Discovery Committee of the Colonial Office. Kemp's dedication to scientific exploration and his passion for understanding the natural world left a lasting impact on the fields of biology and oceanography.
